title.narrative: Mechanism 17712 - Strengthening Strategic Information in Kenya

description.narrative:
Additional detail on PEPFAR financial information and terminology can be found at https://data.pepfar.gov/financial. The PEPFAR IATI activity file and PEPFAR IATI Activity File User's Guide can be found at https://data.pepfar.gov/additionalData
The TBD will support strategic information (SI) in the Republic of Kenya in Monitoring and Evaluation (M&E), Surveillance and mobile health (m-Health) solutions. The M&E TBD will strengthen M&E capacity in Kenya to collect and use data to measure HIV/AIDS response. The target is health care workers in the 47 counties using M&E e-learning and mentorship model. In collaboration with Ministry of Hea Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.11: Treatment/Adult Treatment. Including infrastructure, training clinicians and other providers, exams, clinical monitoring, related laboratory services, and community-adherence activities. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.5: Sexual Prevention - Other Sexual Prevention. Other activities (including training) aimed at preventing HIV transmission including purchase and promotion of condoms, STI management (if not in palliative care settings/context), messages/programs to reduce other risks of persons engaged in high-risk behaviors. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.14: Strategic Information. HIV/AIDS behavioral and biological surveillance, facility surveys, monitoring partner results, reporting results, supporting health information systems, assisting countries to establish and/or strengthen such systems, and related analysis and data dissemination activities fall under strategic information. objectives

The TBD will support strategic information (SI) in the Republic of Kenya in Monitoring and Evaluation (M&E), Surveillance and mobile health (m-Health) solutions. The M&E TBD will strengthen M&E capacity in Kenya to collect and use data to measure HIV/AIDS response. The target is health care workers in the 47 counties using M&E e-learning and mentorship model. In collaboration with Ministry of Health (MOH), the project will: build M&E capacity of health workers in cohort analysis, provide TA to MOH in review, revision and roll out of M&E framework, tools, policies and SOPs, support M&E coordination and collaboration at National and sub-National levels and strengthen quality of HIV data.
In surveillance, the goal is to provide technical assistance (TA) to Government of Kenya (GOK), MOH and partners in priority surveys and surveillance activities. The partner will: provide TA to GOK and their partners in planning, implementation, analysis, and dissemination of survey and surveillance activities, build surveillance and epidemiologic skills, data analysis, interpretation and dissemination and support core PEPFAR programs by improving surveillance systems to adequately and accurately measure outcomes and impact.
Working with National AIDS and STI Control Programme (NASCOP), National Blood Transfusion Services (NBTS), the TBD will work to support health information systems (HIS) related MDGs, MOH HIS policy and mobile health activities and will: increase access to HIV care and health-related information, enhance disease detection and monitoring, improve timeliness of health information, and expedite access to continuing medical education. Components of this mechanism are to develop, rollout, and build capacity of GOK to manage innovations in a sustainable way in Kenya

policy-marker.narrative: The U.S. President's Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief (PEPFAR) is the U.S. government's response to the global HIV/AIDS epidemic and represents the largest commitment by any nation to address a single disease in history.
